stories.title: Mitre updates list of top most dangerous software bugs

stories.text: We can all agree the state of password management on any platform isn't ideal, but some are better than others. Textual passwords are needed for some use cases obviously, but at large this isn't the case. With steganography or simple checksums alone I could easily see the possibilities that support the argument why images may be valid. Why would this not work in practice?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why aren't images used as passwords?
Verizon’s Smart Display is real and it’s just as pointless as we suspected

stories.text: 6 months ago I created a web app that pays users for the traffic they bring to the web app via a URL. Things have been running smooth and profitable. I had an attorney write up a solid ToS but I'm concerned that some users may find a way to fake their traffic. I have a basic visit_log that shows me HTTP logs with IP and time_spent on page. I know easy it is to send fake bot traffic. My biggest fear is waking up and seeing I have to pay a user 6 digits for fake traffic.
stories.title: Ask HN: I'm paying my users, how can I prevent fraud?
